title: Named Entity Recognition: Can't save a model as SavedModel
body:
**Describe the bug**
Can't save a savedmodel with `model.save_savedmodel` for NER model:
```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-26-fa6d24f46d98> in <module>()
----> 1 model.save_savedmodel("/content")

5 frames
/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/autograph/impl/api.py in wrapper(*args, **kwargs)
    697       except Exception as e:  # pylint:disable=broad-except
    698         if hasattr(e, 'ag_error_metadata'):
--> 699           raise e.ag_error_metadata.to_exception(e)
    700         else:
    701           raise

TypeError: Exception encountered when calling layer "sequence_output_feature_1" (type SequenceOutputFeature).

in user code:

    File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ludwig/features/base_feature.py", line 260, in call  *
        hidden = self.prepare_decoder_inputs(
    File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ludwig/features/base_feature.py", line 486, in prepare_decoder_inputs  *
        feature_hidden = self.output_specific_fully_connected(
    File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/ludwig/features/base_feature.py", line 446, in output_specific_fully_connected  *
        feature_hidden = tf.reshape(

    TypeError: Failed to convert elements of [-1, None, 256] to Tensor. Consider casting elements to a supported type. See https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/python/tf/dtypes for supported TF dtypes.


Call arguments received:
  • inputs=({'combiner_output': 'tf.Tensor(shape=(None, None, 768), dtype=float32)', 'lengths': 'tf.Tensor(shape=(None,), dtype=int32)'}, {})
  • training=None
  • mask=None
  ```

**To Reproduce**
1. Create a model with config:
```python
config = {
        "input_features": [
            {
                "name": "text",
                "type": "text",
                "level": "word",
                "encoder": "bert",
                "trainable": True,
                "reduce_output": None,
                "preprocessing": {
                  "word_tokenizer": "space"
                }
            }
        ],
        "output_features": [
            {
                "name": "tag",
                "type": "sequence",
                "decoder": "tagger",
            }
        ],
        'training': {
            'batch_size': 32,
            'decay': True,
            'learning_rate': 0.0001,
            'epochs': 10
        }
    }
```
2. Train
3. `model.save_savedmodel("/content")`
4. See error

Gist and data sample:
https://gist.github.com/orkenstein/29d4e58155584c4cf30b41ce76558b3a

**Expected behavior**
Saved model as Tensorflow SavedModel

**Environment (please complete the following information):**

- Google Colab
- Python 3.7.12
- Ludwig v0.4
